channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Jaguar's 2022 I-Pace gives US drivers faster charging and a new infotainment system
item.description: Jaguar has unveiled the 2022 I-Pace, and it brigs significant updates to the US that include faster charging and a new infotainment system.

item.title: Google's Firmina subsea cable will connect the US to Brazil, Argentina and Uruguay
item.description: Google is making a big push to improve connectivity in South America with its new Firmina subsea cable. It'll run from the US East Coast to Las Toninas, Argentina, with additional connections in Punda del Este, Uruguay and Praia Grande, Brazil.

item.title: Everything you need to know about 'Battlefield 2042'
item.description: Most importantly? It's not Battlefield V.

item.title: Uber's updated app makes it easier for drivers to pick you up
item.description: They'll also be able to choose alternate routes to help complete trips faster.

item.title: Learn American Sign Language with 21 highly rated courses
item.description: For less than $20, you can get access to over 1,000 lessons on ASL.

item.title: President Biden revokes Trump orders aimed at TikTok and WeChat
item.description: President Biden has revoked Trump executive orders meant to limit TikTok and WeChat, but has issued his own orders reviewing security for these apps.

item.title: Watch the first trailer for 'Battlefield 2042'
item.description: EA will reveal the next 'Battlefield' game at 10AM Eastern, and you can watch the live introduction here.

item.title: Civilized Cycles' Model 1 is a posh, surprisingly practical e-bike
item.description: For many, e-bikes have become a fixture of life in New York City. Couriers use them to zip between apartments, bags of fragrant takeout in tow. Tourists grab them from CitiBike stands to lazily loop around parks. And more recently, an uptick in sales has proven residents are embracing these easy rides as they contend with streets that still aren’t quite as full as they used to be. Point is, we’ve seen a lot of them cruising through the boroughs in the last year. But none of them look like the Civilized Cycles Model 1.

item.title: Motorola reveals yet another Moto G Stylus, this time with 5G
item.description: We weren’t quite sure to make of Motorola’s first Moto G Stylus way back in 2020, but the company was clearly onto something: the subsequent 2021 model quickly became the best-selling phone in its G-series lineup. Maybe that’s why Motorola was so keen to announce yet another new Moto G Stylus today. The new Moto G Stylus 5G will set you back $400 when it goes on sale on June 14th, and we went hands-on to see if it has the chops to compete with a new wave of affordable 5G devices.

item.title: NVIDIA RTX 3070 Ti review: A solid replacement for the 2070 Super
item.description: NVIDIA's RTX 3070 Ti is a solid upgrade for owners of the RTX 2070 Super, but not a huge leap from the 3070.

item.title: Asana adds video messaging because this meeting could've been an email
item.description: With help from Vimeo, it’s adding an asynchronous video messaging feature.

item.title: El Salvador becomes the first country to approve Bitcoin as legal currency
item.description: El Salvador has voted to adopt Bitcoin as legal tender.

item.title: The Morning After: Ford made a small hybrid truck that sells for $21,495
item.description: The Ford Maverick is here, and so is Amazon's Sidewalk mesh network -- we'll get you up to speed on both of them.

item.title: Vivaldi adds mail, calendar, RSS and translation tools to its privacy-focused browser
item.description: Vivaldi has updated its web browser to add built-in translation, more layouts, and beta versions of mail, calendar and an RSS reader.

item.title: iOS 15 lets Siri perform tasks on a locked iPhone, if you own an Apple Watch
item.description: iOS 15 expands the 'Unlock with Apple Watch' feature.

item.title: Facebook wants an AI that can beat the 'hardest game in the world'
item.description: Facebook is asking for the AI community’s help in bringing low NetHack — one of the most notoriously difficult titles in gaming history — and maybe help computers learn to simulate instances faster using fewer resources.

item.title: HBO Max update mostly fixes its broken Apple TV app
item.description: HBO Max has updated its Apple TV app to address technical glitches.

item.title: Google quietly ends support for its augmented reality Measure app
item.description: Google kills its augmented reality Measure app.

item.title: Kevin Hart's Quibi show is getting a second season with Roku
item.description: Roku has announced that it has ordered a second season of Kevin Hart's "Die Hart," that will of course be titled "Die Harter."

item.title: Senate passes competitiveness bill with $52 billion for chip manufacturing
item.description: A bill allocating billions to increase US chip manufacturing and research has passed the Senate in a 68 - 32 vote.

item.title: Lordstown Motors warns it doesn't have enough cash to produce electric trucks
item.description: Lordstown Motors will need additional funding to get its electric pickup on the market.

item.title: Netflix's live-action 'Cowboy Bebop' series starts streaming this fall
item.description: 3, 2, 1, let's jam.

item.title: Peacock comes to Samsung smart TVs
item.description: This is its first significant expansion for the streaming service since it made its way to Roku devices last September following protracted negotiations between Roku and NBCUniversal.

item.title: Razer's Audio app leaks images of these Opus X headphones
item.description: Looking through the changelog of the latest version of the Razer Audio app on Android, XDA Developers noticed Razer says the software is compatible with the "Opus X," a pair of headphones the company has yet to release.

item.title: A new plant-based tuna is coming to restaurants in 2022
item.description: The next time you visit a sushi restaurant, the delicious spicy tuna rolls that come with your sushi platter may not come from a fish at all.
